intro: Shibataea, commonly known as the Japanese tree fern, is a member of the Cyatheaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feathery fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions of Asia. Its rhizome is fibrous and can be used in traditional medicine. Shibataea is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in forest ecosystems.
